revised_title: Infra-Red Absorption Spectrum of Methylene Chloride: New Findings and Analysis
tldr: The authors studied the infra-red absorption spectrum of methylene chloride, a widely used solvent, and discovered 26 absorption bands, 16 of which are new. They found that the strongest absorption band has no counterpart in the Raman spectrum, which led to a detailed discussion of the fundamental frequencies of the molecule.
